trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> objects.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object represents the primary key of a record in a data-bound control.

In general, data-bound controls that display multiple records (such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control) use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> object to store the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> objects for the records displayed in the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> class supports several ways to access the items in the collection:
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.Item%2A> indexer to directly retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object from the collection at a specific zero-based index.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items in the collection into an array, which can then be used to access the items in the collection.
To determine the total number of items in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.Count%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> class using the specified <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> object.
The <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> object contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> objects with which to populate the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> objects with which to populate the collection.
Copies all the items from this collection to the specified array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> objects, starting at the specified index in the array.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items from the collection into the specified array, starting at the specified index.
The array can then be used to access the items in the collection.
You must use a zero-based array for the `array` parameter.
A zero-based array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> objects that receives the copied items from the collection.
The first index in the specified array to receive the copied contents.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.Count%2A> property to determine the number of items in the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine its upper bound.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.Count%2A> property is also commonly used to determine whether a collection is empty.
The number of items in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> objects in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.GetEnumerator%2A> method to get an enumerator that can be iterated through linearly to access each item in the collection.
To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

When you initially get the enumerator or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref>-implemented object that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> objects in the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether the items in the collection can be modified.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.IsReadOnly%2A> property to determine whether the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> collection can be modified.

This property has been overridden to always return `false`, to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> object can be added or removed.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> objects themselves cannot be changed.
`false` in all cases.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref> collection is synchronized (thread safe).
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.IsSynchronized%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> object is thread safe.
This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> object is not thread safe.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> object from the collection at the specified index.
Use this indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey> object from the collection at the specified index, using array notation.
This property is read-only.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKey"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Gets the object used to synchronize access to the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.SyncRoot%2A> property to get an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> object itself.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Copies all the items from this collection to the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified index in the <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.

This implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.System%23Collections%23ICollection%23CopyTo%2A> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> class to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> collection into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, starting at the specified index.
The <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> can then be used to access the items in the collection.
You must use a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> for the `array` parameter.
A zero-based <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that receives the copied items from the collection.
The first index in the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to receive the copied contents.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23IsTrackingViewState%2A> property is used to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> object is tracking its view-state changes.
This property is used primarily by control developers.
`true` to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref> is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> method is used to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> object.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref>.
Saves the current view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> class to save the state of the object.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref>.
Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view-state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray"></xref> object.
This method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyArray> object as part of the object's view state.
